history.review_excerpt:
If this product was indeed EWG verified, it would not only be on the website but it would have the EWG logo on the product plus it wouldn’t have linalool which is high on the allergy list.

Other than the linalool, this has decent ingredients. I would stay away from this product if you have malassezia (fungal) acne as olive and japonica may be triggers and/or pore clogging.

Like all natural bar shampoos, it won’t lather like traditional synthetic shampoos but it does clean. It takes some getting use too and a period of detoxing for your hair to get use to the change in chemicals if you are switching from synthetic to natural but it is worth it!

I would recommend this shampoo bar however I am rather concerned about the EWG verified claim.
history.review_full:
I searched the EWG website for this company and product and in many spelling varieties and came up empty handed. If this product was indeed EWG verified, it would not only be on the website but it would have the EWG logo on the product plus it wouldn’t have linalool which is high on the allergy list.

Other than the linalool, this has decent ingredients. It is silicone free, paraben free, sulfate free and alcohol free. I would stay away from this product if you have malassezia (fungal) acne as olive and japonica may be triggers and/or pore clogging.

Like all natural bar shampoos, it won’t lather like traditional synthetic shampoos but it does clean. It takes some getting use too and a period of detoxing for your hair to get use to the change in chemicals if you are switching from synthetic to natural but it is worth it!

I would recommend this shampoo bar however I am rather concerned about the EWG verified claim.
history.review_title: Paraben free, silicone free, sulfate free but not EWG verified

history.review_excerpt:
It even has that slight fragrance that will remind you of vintage lipsticks.

I normally wear red that has a little more blue in it, so was surprised that this clear red was fine for me. But go for the high voltage dramatic red if you want to be noticed.

Very comfortable lipstick, but I didn't have a problem with it bleeding. Opaque coverage with one swipe.
Another plus, it makes your teeth look super white.
I hope that this review as well as the photographs can help you to make a decision about this lipstick. It's really hard buying such things online, especially when it comes to luxury brands like this.
history.review_full:
From pin-up girls to starlets, from old Hollywood movie queen royalty to the girls at the automat, certain red lipsticks have dominated makeup counters for decades.
This is one of them.

Everything about this lipstick, except for the modern wearability, is vintage glamour. The shape of the tube and the shape of the lipstick itself harkens to another era. Perfect for making the ultimate Cupid's bow pout. It even has that slight fragrance that will remind you of vintage lipsticks.

I normally wear red that has a little more blue in it, so was surprised that this clear red was fine for me. To me that says that it will flatter a wide range of skin tones.
After swiping it on my wrist and then wiping it away, it left a nice stain. If you aren't interested in that drop dead gorgeous look and want something a little more subtle, it does double duty by leaving a pinky red stain when blotted. But go for the high voltage dramatic red if you want to be noticed.

Very comfortable lipstick, but I didn't have a problem with it bleeding. Non-drying and non-cracking. Opaque coverage with one swipe.
Another plus, it makes your teeth look super white.
I hope that this review as well as the photographs can help you to make a decision about this lipstick. It's really hard buying such things online, especially when it comes to luxury brands like this.

history.review_excerpt:
Not only are these sheets good for do-it-yourself masks, but they're fabulous at making any good serum a high-end mask.
What I like to do is open one of the individual packets and pull out the tablet, which is a compressed mask. It's easy to pat it into your skin to make it stay.
Lean back and relax, I generally do it for half an hour.
Remove the mask and gently massage the remaining serum into your face, and continue with your facial routine of moisturizer, sunscreen, whatever you use next.
So, whether you dip them in pineapple juice, apple cider vinegar, or whatever your DIY routine is, or you use a prepared serum from your favorite brand, these are convenient, easy to use, and relatively inexpensive.
I especially like the individual packaging because they stay sanitary.
history.review_full:
Not only are these sheets good for do-it-yourself masks, but they're fabulous at making any good serum a high-end mask.
What I like to do is open one of the individual packets and pull out the tablet, which is a compressed mask. And then, I take very hot water in order to get it to open up. After cleansing my face, I will load it with serum, and then put the warm mask over my face. It's easy to pat it into your skin to make it stay.
Lean back and relax, I generally do it for half an hour.
Remove the mask and gently massage the remaining serum into your face, and continue with your facial routine of moisturizer, sunscreen, whatever you use next.
So, whether you dip them in pineapple juice, apple cider vinegar, or whatever your DIY routine is, or you use a prepared serum from your favorite brand, these are convenient, easy to use, and relatively inexpensive.
I especially like the individual packaging because they stay sanitary. I can pop a couple of them in my makeup bag and always be ready to go on any adventure that requires an overnight stay.
Thanks for reading.

heldout.review_full:
[[VIDEOID:5c532f5f5d94b55721fdf6748ddcc641]] I want you to try these for two reasons, first of all because I often make my own DIY cosmetics, including lip balms and glosses. These applicators are perfect to use with those.
Also, have you ever found that perfect shade of lipstick that you can't live without, only to find that it's been discontinued? These applicators help get every last bit of lipstick out of a tube so that you can enjoy it longer.
As you can see, the colors are pretty bright. I think that these would look more upscale in more muted colors, and if that's what you're going for, I would suggest getting the other color option in these. To be honest, what I would prefer, is if they were paper or wood instead of plastic. A little more environmentally friendly.
Still, they're good for what they are. The doe-foot tip Is slanted, just like with your favorite tubed liquid lip products. They are fuzzy, so they hold the lip product.
Makeup artists, as well as their clientele, will appreciate that these can be used once and then tossed. No spreading of germs and bacteria.

history.review_excerpt:
My wife has always wanted to try magnetic eyelashes, so she decided to give these a shot. But, with these practice makes perfect.

They come with 2 tubes of magnetic eyeliner (black), and 10 sets of eyelashes along with the application tool. I would do thinner lines if possible, with about 2 layers so that the eyeliner is not overwhelming. Once the eyeliner dries, use the application tool to put the lashes on.

It does feel a bit strange at first (if false lashes are new to you), and it may tickle around your eyes when you blink. But yes, these really work! With more practice my wife will get better at this.

The only thing is that the magnetic eyeliner does not come off easily.
history.review_full:
My wife has always wanted to try magnetic eyelashes, so she decided to give these a shot. They really do work! But, with these practice makes perfect.

They come with 2 tubes of magnetic eyeliner (black), and 10 sets of eyelashes along with the application tool. When you apply the magnetic eyeliner, you have to be precise. The eyeliner is black, and will look very dark if you do too thick of a line. I would do thinner lines if possible, with about 2 layers so that the eyeliner is not overwhelming. Once the eyeliner dries, use the application tool to put the lashes on.

It does feel a bit strange at first (if false lashes are new to you), and it may tickle around your eyes when you blink. But yes, these really work! With more practice my wife will get better at this.

The only thing is that the magnetic eyeliner does not come off easily. You will need a good eye makeup remover to get this off as it’s waterproof!

history.review_excerpt:
I have another Phoera kit, and I like it a lot.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B093GFPFP9

I am not sure if Nude (#102) is the lightest shade they have or not, but if you are like me and have fair skin with cool undertones this may lean a little warm. Doesn't settle into every nook and cranny, nor dry flakes.
My skin is 40+ so this is something I look for in make up.

The primer is fantastic. To provide a more sheer wash, just change up your application- use a damp sponge to put it on, or use a damp sponge as last step to blend it in and lighten it up.

I really think it is worth the try. I wasn't even going to try this, but since they provided so much information in their product description it really piqued my interest.
history.review_full:
Primer, liquid Foundation, BB cushion, and a flat kabuki brush. I have another Phoera kit, and I like it a lot.
https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B093GFPFP9

I am not sure if Nude (#102) is the lightest shade they have or not, but if you are like me and have fair skin with cool undertones this may lean a little warm. It isn't bad, but if they had a better match available I would want to get that.
THEY DO!! this is for fair with pink undertones
https://www.amazon.com/dp/B07RZ6QZLJ/

The BB cushion is a tad lighter, and a better match for my skin. I do like both. I tend to like cushion over liquid, but both of these are fantastic. I really like how these feel, and despite being a little warm on my cool skin, the make up looks good on the skin. Doesn't settle into every nook and cranny, nor dry flakes.
My skin is 40+ so this is something I look for in make up.

The primer is fantastic. A LITTLE GOES A LONG WAY. Use less than you think you need lest you want a more oily look to seep through. I find that primers like this are great for dry skin, and for more dry feeling foundations.. but their foundations arent drying. So less is more with their primer.

The formula for the liquid foundation really impresses me. Staying power is good. Skin feels comfortable. Skin looks healthy. I can touch my skin after and it doesn't feel like there is make up on. Provides really good coverage with a little bit yet doesn't look cakey and fake. Can be built up. I would recommend this over dermablend, personally. All my redness disappears (from Type 1 Rosacea). To provide a more sheer wash, just change up your application- use a damp sponge to put it on, or use a damp sponge as last step to blend it in and lighten it up.

I really think it is worth the try. I wasn't even going to try this, but since they provided so much information in their product description it really piqued my interest. If you need coverage with a natural look.. try this!
history.review_title: excellent coverage, non cakey, doesnt settle into lines, a tad warm for fair, cool skin

history.review_full:
When the times comes to wash my face, this mascara comes off extra easy. I didnt realize how much other mascaras left behind, once I did my usual face wash (oil cleanse to start, then follow up with water based), and the mascara began to break down right away. Very pleased with that.

This SkyHigh mascara is actually lengthening. I have basic lashes, and I dont expect anything magical from mascara. But this is noticeable on my lashes, and as I was swiping it on I could see the lashes looking elongated. Not clumpy (that's good or bad depending on the look you are going for). This has more natural look. I haven't noticed any flaking, definitely no smudging. My eyes are easily irritated by makeup, and this mascara doesnt seem to bother me. I can wear it on both upper and lower lashes.

At a budget friendly price ($5 for 1, or $7 for pack of 2), it is worth trying. I would consider it again at this price. Another cheapie I really like is Essence, which has both waterproof and non waterproof options: https://www.amazon.com/essence-Princess-Effect-Mascara-Cruelty/dp/B00T0C9XRK

history.review_excerpt:
It is very easy to use in liquid form and provides a sensation of freshness followed by a melting effect on contact with the skin.

 ISOHEXADECANE (1) emollient, and skin conditioning, dry-finish ingredient with a powder-like finish.The size of isohexadecane keeps it from penetrating too far into the skin, so it can be a good ingredient to keep other ingredients, like certain antioxidants, on skin’s surface.

POLYSORBATE 60 1-3, depending on usage) Solubilizing agent, and emulsifying. Creamy, waxy

BEHENIC ACID (1) Fatty acid used as a thickening agent and surfactant.

OLEIC/LINOLEIC/LINOLENIC POLYGLYCERIDES (1) binder, emulsion stabilizer, skin-conditioning agent - emollien
1,2-HEXANEDIOL (1) solvent.
history.review_full:
I have used this before! I had used several GoMay products about a two years ago. I have liked them all, and there are some products that I have repurchased (love their aminos face wash). I remember really liking this night cream, and so when it came up as an option to try, I thought maybe it was another version, but no it is the same. I think the change has been in the company. They were entirely a Chinese brand, and now I see USA labeling- but I think it is still a Chinese beauty product. Same stuff that I know and love. Same press down dispenser container. I am copying over my old review as the info is all the same, and my experience is the same. While I dont rate on price, I am pleased at its effectiveness and how it is half the price of similar items I have used.

Safe, effective moisturizing product with promising ingredients. I am used to using several of these ingredients, and I must stress that it is important to use SPF when using anything with retinol. I saw that this has quite a list of ingredients that I am not totally familiar with, so I went through each one and looked them up. I included a short description of each (and included EWG rating for those that like that sort of information). You will note that most all have a very GOOD rating of 1 or 2. The only ingredient that has a higher number (bad) is for the retinol- and that is because of the degree to which retinol/vitamin A, by nature can absorb into the skin (toxicity) and how our skin is more sensitive to UV rays. So again, wear your SPF when using any retinol based products.

--GoMay is a Chinese (turned USA) beauty company and from everything I have used, the products have been impressive in formulation and the thought and safety put into creating it.

--Awesome, attractive container. Has a press down lid that pops out some product. Keeps it clean and safe! BUT if you want to get into the container, the lid does come off.

--Minimal scent- naturally occurring. Can't quite put my finger on the aroma. It dissipates quickly, and it is really faint. Like green tea and plain yogurt.

--The cream absorbs quickly. It just soaks right into my skin. I have skin that leans dry, and I do follow up with either a hydrating sunscreen, or if used at night I add a thicker emollient. Your experience may vary.

3% active retinol-- age eraser, give it time (at least 3-4  months of consistent use)
2% hyaluronic acid-- excellent humectant
Vitamin C, Vitamin E--antioxidants, skin brightener
--------------------------------------------------------------------------
Here is the full list of ingredients:

-AQUA  water!

-BUTYLENE GLYCOL (1) skin-conditioning agent - miscellaneous, solvent, viscosity decreasing agent, humectant, masking, skin conditioning, and viscosity controlling. Texture enhancer.FDA deems it safe.

-GLYCERIN (1-2) humectant, skin protectant, viscosity decreasing agent, perfuming, and solvent

-RETINYL PALMITATE (6-9) Vitamin A which is absorbed into skin and converted to retinol . Skin-conditioning.Concerns regarding Vit A toxicity (especially in pregnant, nursing) as well as increased damage when skin is exposed to UV rays. Wear your SPF, folks- especially when using retinol based products.

-SQUALANE (1) Occlusive, refatting, and skin conditioning

-SORBITAN STEARATE, (1) surfactant - emulsifying agent, and emulsifying

-CETEARYL ALCOHOL (1) fatty alcohol (a good alcohol that DOES NOT pose a risk to sensitizing skin),  emollient, emulsifying, emulsion stabilising,  emollient, texture enhancer

-CETEARYL GLUCOSIDE (2)  emulsifying agent,Texture Enhancer. A blend of cetearyl alcohol and glucose that functions as an emulsifier

GLYCERYL STEARATE (1) A mixture of portions of glycerin and stearic acid used as an emollient, surfactant, and emulsifier.

CYCLOMETHICONE (1) humectant, solvent, and viscosity controlling. An alcohol-free, clear, colorless, odorless, silicone liquid used as a carrying and wetting agent for personal care products.

BETA VULGARIS (BEET) ROOT EXTRACT (1) Skin conditioning

HYDROGENATED POLYDECENE (2)emollient;skin-conditioning agent. Synthetic polymer that functions as an emollient and skin-softening agent.

HYDROXYETHYL ACRYLATE/SODIUM ACRYLOYLDIMETHYL TAURATE COPOLYMER (1)  gelling agent that thickens, emulsifies, and stabilizes products and solutions. It is very easy to use in liquid form and provides a sensation of freshness followed by a melting effect on contact with the skin.

 ISOHEXADECANE (1) emollient, and skin conditioning, dry-finish ingredient with a powder-like finish.The size of isohexadecane keeps it from penetrating too far into the skin, so it can be a good ingredient to keep other ingredients, like certain antioxidants, on skin’s surface.

POLYSORBATE 60 1-3, depending on usage) Solubilizing agent, and emulsifying. Helps other ingredients to dissolve in a solvent in which they would not normally dissolve. They also help to form emulsions by reducing the surface tension of the substances to be emulsified.

SORBITAN ISOSTEARATE (1)  emulsifying agent,  used to thicken and stabilize cosmetics formulation
BEESWAX (1) thickening agent

XYLITYLGLUCOSIDE (1) An ingredient derived from two water-binding plant sugars, xylitol and glucose. Its trade name is Aquaxyl. It works to improve skin moisturization by preventing water loss.

ANHYDROXYLITOL (1)skin-conditioning agent , humectant. A natural, plant-derived ingredient that acts as a humectant to help skin absorb and retain moisture

TOCOPHEROL (1) Vitamin E- antioxidant,  occlusive, and skin conditioning

 ASCORBIC ACID (1) Vitamin C-  potent antioxidant and skin-soothing agent and can improve the appearance of signs of aging and help brighten an uneven skin tone

 SODIUM HYALURONATE (1) humectant, and skin conditioning, Salt form of skin-replenishing ingredient hyaluronic acid; considered more effective for skin than pure hyaluronic acid due to its greater compatibility

 CAMELLIA SINENSIS POLYPHENOLS (1-2 depending on usage) Green tea! antioxidant, fragrance ingredient, ultraviolet light absorber, antimicrobial, astringent, emollient, humectant,

FULLERENES (1) antimicrobial and skin conditioning. A potent antioxidant that can scavenge free radicals.  is one way to slow down wrinkles and pigmentation. The double bonds in the fullerene can easily react with free radicals, soaking them up like a “radical sponge” so they can’t react with your skin and damage it.

 ECTOIN (1) a synthetic ingredient that serves as an emollient on skin and can also have a buffering effect in cosmetic formulas.

 BUTYROSPERMUM PARKII (SHEA BUTTER) (1) occlusive, viscosity increasing agent - nonaqueous, skin conditioning, emollient, anti-aging

CHENOPODIUM QUINOA SEED EXTRACT (1) skin-conditioning agent.  Rich in essential fatty acids. These essential fatty acids restore the skin’s barrier function, which helps to keep the skin hydrated and soft. This extract also contains vitamin C and E, powerful antioxidants that can protect the skin from free radicals caused by factors such as UV radiation and pollution

HYDROXYACETOPHENONE (1) synthetic antioxidant and skin-conditioning ingredient  capable of neutralizing several different types of free radicals.

PETROLATUM (1-4, depends on usage. "Good" for skin care) petrolatum is a rich emollient and FDA-approved skin protectant. It is one of the best ingredients for dry to very dry skin, including around the eyes. Although derived from crude oil (thus making petrolatum a natural ingredient), it is highly purified prior to being used in cosmetics, so there’s no risk of exposure to unwanted chemicals.

HYDROGENATED LECITHIN (1-2) Hydrogenated form of the skin-restoring ingredient lecithin. Emulsifying agent, suspending agent

MYRISTIC ACID (1) fragrance ingredient, opacifying agent, surfactant - cleansing agentsurfactant-cleansing agent is included as a function for the soap form of myristic acid., cleansing, emulsifying, and perfuming

STEARYL ALCOHOL (1) Fatty alcohol used as an emollient and to help keep other ingredients intact in a formulation. NOT a drying, irritating types of alcohol (such as SD alcohol or denatured alcohol).

TOCOPHERYL ACETATE (1-2) is a form of vitamin E frequently used in cosmetics for its antioxidant benefit.

BEHENYL ALCOHOL (1)is a thickening agent used in cosmetics. It is not related to irritating forms of alcohol.

STEARIC ACID (1), emulsifier, emollient and lubricant. Helps improve the texture and consistency of other products. Creamy, waxy

BEHENIC ACID (1) Fatty acid used as a thickening agent and surfactant.

OLEIC/LINOLEIC/LINOLENIC POLYGLYCERIDES (1) binder, emulsion stabilizer, skin-conditioning agent - emollien
1,2-HEXANEDIOL (1) solvent. A synthetic preservative and moisture-binding agent belonging to a class of agents known as higher molecular glycols. It is considered non-sensitizing.

 PALMITOYL TRIPEPTIDE-5 (1) A synthetic peptide that is believed to play a role in the appearance of skin firmness Highly bioactive, deeply skin penetrating peptide (palmitoyl tripeptide-5). Has been found in-vitro studies to activate tissue growth factor (TGF-beta

 PROPYLENE GLYCOL (2) is a humectant (hydrating) and delivery ingredient used in cosmetics.   It also helps active ingredients penetrate skin. In the amounts used in cosmetics, it’s not a concern in the least. Fragrance ingredient, humectant, skin-conditioning agent, viscosity controlling

 DENDROBIUM NOBILE EXTRACT  From the Orchid family, anti microbrial, hydrating

MACROCYSTIS PYRIFERA EXTRACT (1) Kelp. Regenerating, revitalizing

ALLANTOIN (1) is a byproduct of uric acid extracted from urea and considered an effective skin-soothing and skin-conditioning agent.

heldout.review_full:
#21 light neutral beige, and it is a pretty good match to my fair, cool skin.

My skin: fair, dry, mid 40s, pink cheeks from Rosacea (visible veins, zero acne). I find that this has light natural coverage using a foundation brush. It tones down my redness with ease. It can be built up, especially if allowed to semi dry between applications. I really like that it has SPF (PA++++) 50. I always use sunscreen, so adding this on top of my sunscreen base is just added protection. Also perfect for reapplication & touch ups through day.

I also find that it is hydrating on my dry skin. Has a dewy finish. My natural skin comes through but looks better- more spruced up and put together looking. I do notice that the finish depends on what I use before hand. When I have used this on bare skin, it has a more mattifying appearance. When I use on top of my moisturizer and/or moisturizing sunscreen, then it has a more dewy radiant look. I prefer the latter.

Seems to stay in place. I applied some to my forearm, and it is still in place a couple hours later. I have taken my finger to try to wipe it off, and it is still there.

4 stars. I prefer it for light coverage. When it is built up, it seems to take on a grayish cast on me.

history.review_excerpt:
It’s worse when you have long legs, short arms.

It’s bad when you have certain chin hairs (thankfully not that much it isn’t manageable another way).

I tried some sugar wax kit back about 20+ years ago. No, the dermaplaning tool didn’t work on them.

I got a wax warmer, so I thought all beads/beans were equal.

These came with ZERO instructions, and the after spray bottle was busted. The wax was sticky, not liquidy, and it cooled almost as soon as it hit my skin.

I let it sit there for a few minutes (over 5), and peeled the max off. But, if this removes thick hair, shouldn’t it remove thinner hair?

I found another patch, got some warm wax – tried it again.
history.review_full:
I think a lot of us want an easier way to remove hair. Shaving, especially for a bigger girl like me, is not that easy. It’s worse when you have long legs, short arms.

It’s bad when you have certain chin hairs (thankfully not that much it isn’t manageable another way).

I tried some sugar wax kit back about 20+ years ago. That was a NIGHTMARE! It was supposedly edible. I think you microwaved the container, spread it on, let it cool, used a paper strip (supplied) to remove the hair. It didn’t work and stung.

I then moved to a hair removal cream, that partially worked.

After that? Back to the hold stand-by –> shave foam/cream and a razor. For my main body parts, that’s always worked. Tough “chin” hairs –> using a tweezer work. No, the dermaplaning tool didn’t work on them.

I got a wax warmer, so I thought all beads/beans were equal.

These came with ZERO instructions, and the after spray bottle was busted. The warmer kit at least had some. And, my warmer kit had specially made, disposable “cups”.

These beads/beans, in a smaller cup, took over 90 minute to melt. And, the warmer was on 180°(F).

I tried a small amount on my arm. The wax was sticky, not liquidy, and it cooled almost as soon as it hit my skin.

I let it sit there for a few minutes (over 5), and peeled the max off. It didn’t hurt, sting, or cause redness – then again …

THE HAIR WAS STILL THERE

Okay, so my hair on my arm is a little thin. But, if this removes thick hair, shouldn’t it remove thinner hair?

I found another patch, got some warm wax – tried it again. Nope. Tried legs, arms, and under my chin. Nothing. Then again, I see I'm not the only one experiencing issues with these beads/beans.

I may have gotten a bad batch. But, I definitely wouldn’t get these again.
history.review_title: Wax On, Wax Off, Hair Still There

history.review_excerpt:
I honestly don’t even know WHERE to begin with this review 🤷🏻‍♀️

I have, in my lifetime – and, wearing “fake” nails for OVER 25 YEARS – NEVER seen this type of … idea 🤦🏻‍♀️

I’ll be as short as possible with this …

Most anyone who hasn’t had an amputation, usually has 8 fingers and 2 thumbs – total of 10 “DIGITS” ✋🏻🤚🏻 And, in MOST cases – the nails are usually shaped the same.

Thus, in a set of nails you’d need:

💅🏻 2 – Thumb nails
💅🏻 2 – Index fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Middle fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Ring fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Pinkie fingernails

I know – sounds almost silly or stupid to mention, but that’s math. Total “NAILS” needed: 10 … (“Luxury 12pcs press on nails kit comes with 10 different sizes which is pre-numbered 0-9 in a box” … “choose the most suitable size that fits you every finger”).
history.review_full:
I honestly don’t even know WHERE to begin with this review 🤷🏻‍♀️

I have, in my lifetime – and, wearing “fake” nails for OVER 25 YEARS – NEVER seen this type of … idea 🤦🏻‍♀️

I’ll be as short as possible with this …

Most anyone who hasn’t had an amputation, usually has 8 fingers and 2 thumbs – total of 10 “DIGITS” ✋🏻🤚🏻 And, in MOST cases – the nails are usually shaped the same.

Thus, in a set of nails you’d need:

💅🏻 2 – Thumb nails
💅🏻 2 – Index fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Middle fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Ring fingernails
💅🏻 2 – Pinkie fingernails

I know – sounds almost silly or stupid to mention, but that’s math. Total “NAILS” needed: 10 … (“Luxury 12pcs press on nails kit comes with 10 different sizes which is pre-numbered 0-9 in a box” … “choose the most suitable size that fits you every finger”). Hard to fit every finger when the nails are different sizes.

And, we’re NOT all sized the same. Hence why some packaging is no less than 24 nails with 12 sizes. I know because I’ve bought nails like this for YEARS! Just look up KISS and you’ll see what I am talking about.

This?

Was this a joke? This is a set of TWELVE (12) nails – 10 different sizes! 🤷🏻‍♀️🤦🏻‍♀️

Unlike the model hands – I don’t wear my nails OVER the edges of my finger. That is NOT how you wear these nails to begin with – and definitely NOT with nail glue. Even being “fake”, the nails should at LEAST attempt to look realistic. See how the salons do them, look on Google (or your favorite search engine).

Who thought this was a great idea? And, these HAVE to be the LARGEST sizes for the particular “nails” I’ve seen. These really are a fancier version of the Lee and Wet N’ Wild from the late 1980’s/early 1990’.

What’s worse? Even the PACKAGING states: 24

Did they not think anyone would notice that detail?

I’ll admit, these are pretty. And, thinking it was a HALF package, I contacted Amazon for a return/replacement. I cancelled the replacement, but I am returning these. As I told the rep – they’re pretty useless as they are. There is NO way I can use these. I would, at MINIMUM, only get 4 nails worth of coverage. For this price? Nope. Not at all. And, I feel sorry for those who do have to pay.

In addition, the nearly $16 price tag (excluding sales tax) for 12 nails? Unreasonable. In my case, I’d need TWO (2) sets which would run $32. For that price – I might as well just wear a mask, go to the salon, and have them do it for me. My nails would definitely last two weeks, and I wouldn’t have to do them myself.

I will not be getting these again and DO NOT recommend them. The seller might have a better set out there, but not this selection.
history.review_title: Not Sure if This is a Joke

Newborn – birth to 4 weeks

Child – 6-13

That said …

heldout.review_full:
A few things here …

LES ENFANTS is French for CHILDREN

It doesn’t refer to infants or toddlers. For those who don’t know, a quick note …

Newborn – birth to 4 weeks
Infants – 4 weeks to 1 year
Toddler – 1-3
Preschooler – 3-5
Child – 6-13

That said …

It does state NOT TO SPRAY IT ON A BABY’S SKIN. “Applying gently on clothes” is the preferred method. Though to be honest, I’d say this is more for ages 6+

While baby cologne isn’t something I would use on a baby, it could be better for adults who want a light scent and not overwhelmed by a perfume.

For almost $30, this is an 8.5 fl oz spray. Compared to some perfumes and colognes, this is moderately priced.

Smell? It isn’t the greatest. I do like it as a light, after-bathing scent. It seems more suited to a room freshener than a perfume. But, it isn’t the WORST perfume/scent I’ve smelled.

The generous size means it will last a while.

Would I get it again? No. Nor would I recommend it either.

history.review_excerpt:
This pack of 16 nail files from Keiby Citom is a great value.

I started doing dip nails at home, and the worst part is getting off the old manicure. I prefer a glass file for actually shaping my nails, but they’re not good for removing layers of polish.

Using one of these files, I had the top coat filed off all my nails in less than ten minutes. The 100 grit side is perfect. I actually asked a nail tech friend what I should use, and she told me 100 grit.

The files come in a zipper seal plastic bag that can be used to store them.

The edges of the files aren’t sharp. I’m talking about the edges that touch your skin; sometimes these can be sharp, especially on pro files, and need to be seasoned to prevent cuts.

history.review_excerpt:
This jelly facial cleanser from Vitamasques is made in Korea.

The tube has a foil safety seal under the white cap. It does have a scent, a mix of green tea and tea tree oil. I do notice the scent when using the cleanser but the scent doesn’t linger.

A small drop is enough to wash my face and neck. It doesn’t make a lot of lather but does feel silky going on the skin. I really like the consistency of it.

And I really like how well the cleanser works! Some face washes don’t remove all the sunscreen residue, and I have to keep washing my face or use an exfoliating scrub. I was amazed by how well it worked.

I’m in my 30s, white, with sensitive combination skin.
history.review_full:
This jelly facial cleanser from Vitamasques is made in Korea.

The tube has a foil safety seal under the white cap. The cleanser is brown with a jelly-like consistency. It does have a scent, a mix of green tea and tea tree oil. I do notice the scent when using the cleanser but the scent doesn’t linger.

A small drop is enough to wash my face and neck. It doesn’t make a lot of lather but does feel silky going on the skin. I really like the consistency of it.

And I really like how well the cleanser works! It cleaned two layers of sunscreen grime and sweat off my face. Some face washes don’t remove all the sunscreen residue, and I have to keep washing my face or use an exfoliating scrub. This cleanser? One wash and done. I was amazed by how well it worked.

I’m in my 30s, white, with sensitive combination skin. The cleanser did not irritate my face at all.

heldout.review_excerpt:
So I thought this sleeping mask would be great. Put it on before bed and wake up with a hydrated, healthier face.

The directions say “Apply a generous layer before you sleep or whenever your skin needs a nourishing boost.” I started with a small pea-sized drop, which was enough for my whole face.

The mask has a gel consistency and goes on clear. But it did not absorb into my skin. No way would I go to sleep like that, my face would stick to the pillow.

So I washed the mask off, which was a disappointment since it’s supposed to be a “non-wash off mask.” My skin was a little softer, but having to wash my face because it was still sticky defeats the purpose of a mask that I’m supposed to be able to wear to sleep.
heldout.review_full:
The Multivitamin Sleeping Mask by Vitamasques is made in Korea. The tube has a foil safety seal under the cap.

I liked the concept of a face mask I could wear to bed. I’m not as good as I should be at keeping to a proper skincare routine. So I thought this sleeping mask would be great. Put it on before bed and wake up with a hydrated, healthier face.

The directions say “Apply a generous layer before you sleep or whenever your skin needs a nourishing boost.” I started with a small pea-sized drop, which was enough for my whole face.

The mask has a gel consistency and goes on clear. But it did not absorb into my skin. After fifteen minutes, my face was still sticky and tacky. No way would I go to sleep like that, my face would stick to the pillow.

So I washed the mask off, which was a disappointment since it’s supposed to be a “non-wash off mask.” My skin was a little softer, but having to wash my face because it was still sticky defeats the purpose of a mask that I’m supposed to be able to wear to sleep.

history.review_excerpt:
While XXI Bio-Pure facial moisturizer is packed with great skin care ingredients such as jojoba, shea butter, aloe vera, sunflower seed oil and glycerin, I think its the Vitamin C that really makes this an exceptional product. I've not found many products that are able to do this to my skin but XXI does!

I have dry , sensitive skin and have no issues with this cream

XXI works. Because it works so well and delivers great results and only a small amount is needed per use, I do believe the price is reasonable. However, if you find this isn't right for you, XXI offers a 30 day satisfaction guarantee. I absolutely recommend XXI Bio-Pure lotion.
history.review_full:
While XXI Bio-Pure facial moisturizer is packed with great skin care ingredients such as jojoba, shea butter, aloe vera, sunflower seed oil and glycerin, I think its the Vitamin C that really makes this an exceptional product. At least for my skin it's exceptional.

This is a nice, lightweight moisturizer that absorbs quickly and doesn't cause skin to look/feel oily or greasy. It softens and smooths skin. Fine lines are thinned. My dry, sensitive skin looks and feels refreshed. And thanks to Vitamin C, my normally dull skin has a dewy glow. I've not found many products that are able to do this to my skin but XXI does!

I have dry , sensitive skin and have no issues with this cream

XXI works. It works VERY well and some results like soft, smooth skin occur immediately after use. Results are long lasting. XXI recommends using this in the morning and at night. I use it once a day in the morning. A very small amount is sufficient to cover my face. Because it works so well and delivers great results and only a small amount is needed per use, I do believe the price is reasonable. However, if you find this isn't right for you, XXI offers a 30 day satisfaction guarantee. I absolutely recommend XXI Bio-Pure lotion.

history.review_excerpt:
This is a very unique and effective product.

Used with a light pre-styler on medium-length hair:

Scent: It's a light scent. Becomes slightly tacky when emulsifying.
Styling: Smooth through the hair at first, with increasing tug the more you style. This is not a problem for me and is part of getting great hold from a product.
Finish: Slightly shiny at first, but becomes much more matte as it dries in the hair.
Hold: Legitimate all-day hold without becoming too rigid to restyle.

This is one of my new favorites. Seriously good in all areas, which is so rare. TheSalonGuy has a real winner with this one.
history.review_full:
This is a very unique and effective product.

Used with a light pre-styler on medium-length hair:

Scent: It's a light scent. Warm and slightly spiced. Very pleasant and masculine.
Consistency: Extremely creamy. Becomes slightly tacky when emulsifying.
Styling: Smooth through the hair at first, with increasing tug the more you style. This is not a problem for me and is part of getting great hold from a product.
Finish: Slightly shiny at first, but becomes much more matte as it dries in the hair.
Hold: Legitimate all-day hold without becoming too rigid to restyle.

This is one of my new favorites. Seriously good in all areas, which is so rare. TheSalonGuy has a real winner with this one.

history.review_excerpt: The dragon in this set is really awesome looking. It's quite a clever toy and involves some skill in aiming the car correctly to hit the dragon. I think kids stay with a toy longer if there is some challenge to it and not just a passive toy. Very colorful and fun. With all the moving parts and a lot of plastic, I am not sure how long it would last without breaking. Unfortunately just about everything is made from plastic these days, so there is not much choice for truly durable toys. Although probably best suited for a boy, I can't imagine any kid, boy or girl, not liking this.

history.review_excerpt: My great grandson who is about 6 did not care for this toy. In order to launch Thomas the train engine, you have to physically tip up the track. The engine runs along a track and a shark tries to grab it; then it does a loop. The included helicopter is supposed to carry Thomas off to safety after he escapes the shark, but obviously that's something that occurs only in a child's imagination. The helicopter is just an extra included toy and can stand alone. It's not a bad toy and the engine is cute and well made. Probably not something that your child would find that many hours of entertainment from. There are better toys out there for about the same money.
history.review_full: My great grandson who is about 6 did not care for this toy.  In order to launch Thomas the train engine, you have to physically tip up the track.  The function of the toy is rather limited, as it seems to do just one thing.  The engine runs along a track and a shark tries to grab it; then it does a loop.  That's about it.  The included helicopter is supposed to carry Thomas off to safety after he escapes the shark, but obviously that's something that occurs only in a child's imagination.  The helicopter is just an extra included toy and can stand alone.  It's not a bad toy and the engine is cute and well made.  Probably not something that your child would find that many hours of entertainment from.  There are better toys out there for about the same money.

history.review_excerpt: I got these with intentions of giving them to some children, but I like them so well, I am going to keep them. They appear to be quite well constructed, made of a combination of hard plastic, metal and on "Mater" some rubberized material for his mirrors and towing chains. The vehicles are small, being about 3" long and 1 to 2 inches high. They are nicely detailed and well painted and are not cheap looking. They would be fun to play with for kids, especially if they have seen and liked the Cars movie. These seem rugged enough to handle quite a bit of play. They also look nice enough for adult collectors. A fun item for kids or adults

heldout.review_excerpt: The racoon and fox are over half the size of the moose, so the proportions are all wrong. The fox and racoon are about the right size in relation to each other, but next to the moose, the grouping looks strange. The package contains only one small paragraph about the 3 animals, so this is not an educational toy by any stretch of the imagination. Smaller, younger kids probably won't care about any educational benefit anyway or the size proportions of the animals, so this may not be a big deal. I suppose a smart kid would pick up on the size discrepancy if they have ever been to a zoo and seen some of these animals or seen a TV program that showed the sizes.
heldout.review_full: These seem like good quality and the colors are nice and seem accurate.  I was concerned that the horns of the moose might be sharp and could hurt a child if they fell on the toy, but no worries here; the horns are soft and bendable.  If you tried to bend them much, they might break off though.  The price seems reasonable.  If you buy them to teach your children about these animals, there is one problem.  The racoon and fox are over half the size of the moose, so the proportions are all wrong.  The fox and racoon are about the right size in relation to each other, but next to the moose, the grouping looks strange.  Looks like we an have incredibly large mutant fox and racoon or incredibly small mutant moose.  I noticed there are other groupings available in this brand and I would have paired the moose with maybe a bear and a deer.  Then put the fox and racoon with another animal about their size.  The package contains only one small paragraph about the 3 animals, so this is not an educational toy by any stretch of the imagination.  Smaller, younger kids probably won't care about any educational benefit anyway or the size proportions of the animals, so this may not be a big deal.  As a kid, I would have loved a set like this.  I suppose a smart kid would pick up on the size discrepancy if they have ever been to a zoo and seen some of these animals or seen a TV program that showed the sizes.
heldout.review_title: Fox and Racoon too big or Moose is too Small

history.review_excerpt:
If you are looking for a very durable and sturdy selfie stick/tripod then this one might suit you just fine. It extends much further than other selfie sticks, up to 51 inches, ensuring that everyone will be in your picture.

The size of it preludes carrying it in your pocket though! It will not fit inside a purse but it is easily carried in a backpack or larger carry bag.

As a tripod it is infinitely more stable than others smaller ones out there. It pairs easily when your Bluetooth is on.

The only drawback with the remote is that there is no place on the tripod to store it, so you’ll either have to put it on a key ring, or carry it in your pocket.
history.review_full:
If you are looking for a very durable and sturdy selfie stick/tripod then this one might suit you just fine. It extends much further than other selfie sticks, up to 51 inches, ensuring that everyone will be in your picture.

The size of it preludes carrying it in your pocket though! It will not fit inside a purse but it is easily carried in a backpack or larger carry bag.

As a tripod it is infinitely more stable than others smaller ones out there. It has multiple adjustments for the legs.

The remote is very simple and has two buttons. One for iOS and one for android. It pairs easily when your Bluetooth is on.

The only drawback with the remote is that there is no place on the tripod to store it, so you’ll either have to put it on a key ring, or carry it in your pocket.

history.review_excerpt: The case seems pretty durable. Overall I like the style of the case and how it protects the edges and corners of the iPhone. You can rotate this ring but the mechanism is really stiff and there is only a small piece of plastic holding the ring to the side of the mechanism. It is definitely not adequate and if you rotate it a lot, it will break eventually which mine just did. I have had a few cases that had these rings on them and I have yet to find one that will last more than a few months.

history.review_excerpt: First, I live in Florida where power outages intermittently occur but especially during hurricanes. Second, I travel a lot and love to take videos and photos with my iPhone XR. I recently went on a cruise to the Caribbean where I was off the ship many times without access to power. I kept this device in my purse and as soon as I could see the power getting critically low, I was easily able to recharge my phone and continue with my explorations. I have not experienced any hurricanes yet since I have owned this but, as we are in August and quickly approaching the highest part of hurricane season, I am thrilled to know that if I was to lose power I have at least a way to continue to keep in touch with friends and relatives!

Around Christmas I picked out a cute Christmas band which I wore until the season was over. Beginning of January, I ordered a new set of bands which were terrible (see reviews) and I couldn't get them to work. The band (although rubber type as well) has a great ribbed look which makes it look different and fashionable. I got it in white and it looks great with the red face of my iwatch. history.review_excerpt: There are 2 adults, 8 kids, and 2 dogs to clean up after in our house. However, the dirt compartment was full after one room, so it just passed through the rest of the rooms on a sight seeing tour. It is pretty inconvenient to stop and empty this guy every room he finishes, especially since he doesn't necessarily do a room in one go-- he's a little sporadic in his patterns. It would be great for a smaller place or for people without kids and pets, though.
history.review_full:
First, I have a large family. We're likely too much for this poor vacuum. There are 2 adults, 8 kids, and 2 dogs to clean up after in our house. We have more vacuum needs than this vacuum can provide.
Now, it was able to get one entire floor of our house done on one charge. However, the dirt compartment was full after one room, so it just passed through the rest of the rooms on a sight seeing tour. It is pretty inconvenient to stop and empty this guy every room he finishes, especially since he doesn't necessarily do a room in one go-- he's a little sporadic in his patterns. It is also too loud to run at night or while watching TV. It is pretty quick. It does one floor of my house in an hour. It only got stuck twice. Once, someone had angled a dining room chair at an unusual angle to the wall and the vacuum got under and couldn't figure out how to get out. The second time, I left the diaper bag on the floor about 18" away from a shelf and it got between the two and couldn't get out. But it usually found its way around pretty well. It did not auto turn off when it sucked up a scarf. All in all-- it just isn't a good solution for our family. It can only hold about a cup of dirt. We'll stick to our old fashioned vacuum. It would be great for a smaller place or for people without kids and pets, though.

heldout.review_full:
Being nanny for nephew x1 day a week for 36hr- I must prepare to assist in asthma scenario if happens on our watch! With zero nebulizer experience.. I appreciate the straightforward instructions.. Partnered with his parent 411 it can be a lot of pressure- so, easy learning the functionality of device was helpful to be precise to the point!

I cannot stress enough for any who may need to assist at some point- l familiarize yourself prior to an actual event!! Those moments are stressful enough- you don’t want to be “trying to remember” how too’s of the device!!

For a small size device- functions/buttons are clearly marked. *Hack: create 3x5 card with #’d steps to list in simplest form. 1. Turn on 2. adjust mask 3. prep med Etc.. I DID!! “A simple cheat sheet” for peace of mind. I have it at a glance x1-2 word listed to ensure i do it right (Ha..I even had my steps laminated!)

Easy transport and storage when not in use- saves his mama lugging their device over every week!! Included bag will contain all parts so nothing lost. (but, prefer hard sided case for solid protection!)

A big perk is ability to charge device from varied sources- a computer, battery boost or wall butt! Solutions if charge needed and not by a wall outlet.. cord is included and should always be kept with nebulizer!! Im feeling confident to use yet, hope I don’t need! Hoping info helps decision.. stay safe everyone.

Unfortunately, when the southern california summer temps began to reach the 80’s each day, the adhesive began to ‘melt’ and the tape began pulling away after about 2 weeks. The repair sagged and is now about to fall apart. I have enough tape to redo it but I will probably have to redo it a few time before the temps drop back down into the 70’s.

history.review_excerpt:
I am a fan of Gorilla Glue, but this formula is disappointing. I expected more of a gel formula.
The winged twist top cap is really great. Easy to open & has a pun in the cap so when you close, the seal is tight & it keeps the hole open.
The glue comes out very fast so I found it difficult to get a thin bead line. Once you do manage to get everything glued in place, you have to attend it because the glue expands & the items shift. It then takes 24hrs to cure.
I have used this 5 times now & it has been a frustrating mess, no matter how small the amount of glue I use.
I cannot recommend this particular formula of Gorilla Glue.
history.review_full:
I am a fan of Gorilla Glue, but this formula is disappointing. It drips all over the place. I expected more of a gel formula.
The winged twist top cap is really great. Easy to open & has a pun in the cap so when you close, the seal is tight & it keeps the hole open.
The glue comes out very fast so I found it difficult to get a thin bead line. Unless the object you are gluing is flat & set a perfectly horizontal angle, the glue immediately starts dripping. Once you do manage to get everything glued in place, you have to attend it because the glue expands & the items shift. It takes a very very long time for the glue to set to the point you no longer have to babysit it. It then takes 24hrs to cure.
I have used this 5 times now & it has been a frustrating mess, no matter how small the amount of glue I use.
I cannot recommend this particular formula of Gorilla Glue. Spend the extra cash on the premium formula & save yourself hours of messy frustration.

history.review_excerpt:
Think “permanent” before you apply these VELCRO BRAND ALFA-LOK FASTENERS WITH SNAP-LOCK TECHNOLOGY (Strong, Heavy Duty Hold for Indoor Outdoor Use; Semi-Permanent Mounting; 3 x 1-inch strips, 4 sets, Black). (Watch the product page video to see exactly what you’re getting.)

I don’t think I‘d want to use these to attach anything to my car--even the windows--because they’re so hard to remove. However, they’re very easy to use for a lasting, semi-permanent wall mounting of all kinds of things.

For example, they’re ideal for re-attaching a window sensor on my home security system that fell off (along with the paint it was stuck to) when house painters were hammering on the metal window frame.
history.review_full:
Think “permanent” before you apply these VELCRO BRAND ALFA-LOK FASTENERS WITH SNAP-LOCK TECHNOLOGY (Strong, Heavy Duty Hold for Indoor Outdoor Use; Semi-Permanent Mounting; 3 x 1-inch strips, 4 sets, Black). The hold is incredibly strong--much, much stronger than what you’ve come to expect from standard Velcro, or from ordinary adhesive mounting strips. Once they’re set in place, you will need a scraper tool (e.g., [[ASIN:B000KKOPCO chisel paint scraper]]) to remove them. (Watch the product page video to see exactly what you’re getting.)

I don’t think I‘d want to use these to attach anything to my car--even the windows--because they’re so hard to remove. However, they’re very easy to use for a lasting, semi-permanent wall mounting of all kinds of things.

For example, they’re ideal for re-attaching a window sensor on my home security system that fell off (along with the paint it was stuck to) when house painters were hammering on the metal window frame. They’re also useful for attaching temperature/humidity sensors to outdoor surfaces around my condo. It’s important not to use too much--you can easily cut the strips with scissors into smaller squares for smaller items. If you use too much, it will be extremely difficult to pull the item off. These are mounting strips, NOT the usual Velcro closure strips.

It's important to attach these to a clean, stable surface. When I originally attached the window sensor to the nearby painted wall, it fell off almost immediately. But it was the wall paint that failed, not the Alfa-Lok adhesive. The paint was still stuck to the back of the Alfa-Lok square. Also, the instructions say to allow 15 minutes for the adhesive to take hold, before you attach anything.
history.review_title: “Permanent” Mounting Strips With Incredibly Strong Hold

history.review_excerpt:
(See my photos--one of them has been enhanced a little to make the figures and the device names “Air Quality” and “Air Quality 2” easier to read.)

CONNECTION TIPS: The key things to know about the wifi setup are as follows: (1) your phone or tablet (with the app) has to be connected to a 2.4Ghz network; (2) the Temtop monitoring device has to be reset with a paperclip so that you see an “ascending” wireless signal (not just a blinking wireless signal), when you’re joining the home network; and (3) any other Temtop monitoring device already connected to the network should be turned off when you’re connecting the new device.

I’m not positive that step 3 is required, but my second device would NOT connect to my network until I turned the first device off. However, I’m happy with them so far--especially with the real time and historical data available through the app.
history.review_full:
This TEMTOP M10i WIFI AIR QUALITY MONITOR (for PM2.5 TVOC AQI HCHO; Real Time Data Recording) works well, and seems to be accurate enough for my purposes. When I opened a bottle of nail polish in a nearby room, the monitor’s HCHO (formaldehyde) and TVOC (total volatile organic compounds) numbers shot way up. They returned to more normal levels after a few hours.

In fact, I liked this device so well, I purchased another, to keep track of the air quality upstairs as well as downstairs in my home. At first, I had difficulty getting the second device recognized by the app and connected to my home network. However, it IS possible to have two wifi devices displayed in the app. Once the devices are set up, they display separate real time readings, and keep independent data histories. (See my photos--one of them has been enhanced a little to make the figures and the device names “Air Quality” and “Air Quality 2” easier to read.)

CONNECTION TIPS: The key things to know about the wifi setup are as follows: (1) your phone or tablet (with the app) has to be connected to a 2.4Ghz network; (2) the Temtop monitoring device has to be reset with a paperclip so that you see an “ascending” wireless signal (not just a blinking wireless signal), when you’re joining the home network; and (3) any other Temtop monitoring device already connected to the network should be turned off when you’re connecting the new device.

I’m not positive that step 3 is required, but my second device would NOT connect to my network until I turned the first device off. After you get the Temtop devices connected, you can reconnect your phone or tablet to a faster 5Ghz band, and the Temtop app will still work.

AIR QUALITY HISTORY TIPS: First, the air quality history comes up in the app when you tap the area that shows the real time readings. Second, if you try to bring up the history and you see “no data”, you may have to (1) turn the device off and on again, and/or (2) log out of the app and log back in again.

Clearly, it would be nice if the app were less “uppity”, but the air quality monitors seem to be quite responsive to changes. My upstairs monitor shows consistently higher TVOC readings, for example, because the upstairs has more shampoo, Lysol sprays, etc. in regular use. Once an aerosol spray gets into the air, it will take several hours for it to clear.

Also, it would be nice if the app could be set to show local temperatures in Fahrenheit rather than Centigrade. That’s a quibble, though.

I haven’t owned my two devices for very long, so they may stop working prematurely (as other reviewers have reported). However, I’m happy with them so far--especially with the real time and historical data available through the app. You can use the app to set your device to record data at certain intervals--starting at as often as every 10 minutes.

I do have to keep the devices plugged in all the time, because the battery drains so quickly. The battery doesn’t last anywhere close to the promised 6 hours.
history.review_title: App Will Display Data From Two Monitors; Monitors Must Stay Plugged In

It’s much better than a regular foldable shopping cart (e.g., [[ASIN:B00SK9P454 Whitmore utility shopping cart]] because it already has a bag (easily removeable) to contain your groceries, and it converts into a dolly.

For many purposes, it’s better than my excellent [[ASIN:B001601WFU Safeco furniture-mover dolly]] (should be about $50, watch out for added shipping costs), because it’s upright (easier to maneuver than a wheeled platform dolly). The shopping cart/dolly is reasonably priced (about $58 on Amazon).
history.review_full:
This AMAZONBASICS FOLDING SHOPPING CART (Converts into Dolly, 40 inch Handle Height, Black) is so versatile! It’s much better than a regular foldable shopping cart (e.g., [[ASIN:B00SK9P454 Whitmore utility shopping cart]] because it already has a bag (easily removeable) to contain your groceries, and it converts into a dolly.

For many purposes, it’s better than my excellent [[ASIN:B001601WFU Safeco furniture-mover dolly]] (should be about $50, watch out for added shipping costs), because it’s upright (easier to maneuver than a wheeled platform dolly). It’s also sturdier than my [[ASIN:B086D5JXQF Collapsible Luggage Cart]], which is very compact, but has a tiny cargo platform.

The shopping cart/dolly is reasonably priced (about $58 on Amazon). The maximum weight load is 110 lbs., which is as much as I can wrestle onto a dolly anyway. The tall, broad bag opens out to hold at least two big grocery bags’ worth of groceries. A big flap covers them up in bad weather.

The cart easily folds flat for storage or for transport in the trunk of an auto. Assembly is simple, and requires no tools. The hardest part is squeezing the little clamps that click into place to secure the wheels onto the axle. The instruction booklet is very clear, and includes “ear” symbols that tell you when to listen for a click.
history.review_title: Far More Versatile Than Standard Foldable Utility Shopping Cart

heldout.review_excerpt:
This BERTER KNEE BRACE FOR MEN & WOMEN (with Side Stabilizers & Patella Gel Pads, Double Wraps) is quite well-made, considering the price (about $15 on Amazon). However, the brace is hard to place correctly over the kneecap, because the opening is round rather than oval to match the knee’s anatomical shape.

The flexible side stabilizers add some support, but I can feel them above my knee, especially on the outside of my thigh. Overall, I’d say that the Berter brace provides slightly more support than a slip-on, all-elastic[[ASIN:B019ZK0WS0 compression sleeve]].

If you need a serious knee brace for an athletic injury or for arthritis, I think that this more expensive[[ASIN:B07SSQVY3X hinged knee brace]] is a better choice.
heldout.review_full:
This BERTER KNEE BRACE FOR MEN & WOMEN (with Side Stabilizers & Patella Gel Pads, Double Wraps) is quite well-made, considering the price (about $15 on Amazon). However, the brace is hard to place correctly over the kneecap, because the opening is round rather than oval to match the knee’s anatomical shape.

The flexible side stabilizers add some support, but I can feel them above my knee, especially on the outside of my thigh. They make the brace a bit uncomfortable.

The two narrow straps with Velcro secure the brace around the leg, but provide minimal support. The wide elastic straps with Velcro ends do hold the brace securely in place. Overall, I’d say that the Berter brace provides slightly more support than a slip-on, all-elastic[[ASIN:B019ZK0WS0 compression sleeve]].

If you need a serious knee brace for an athletic injury or for arthritis, I think that this more expensive[[ASIN:B07SSQVY3X hinged knee brace]] is a better choice.
heldout.review_title: Slightly More Support Than Compression Sleeve

history.review_full:
When using this kit to install a pegboard, the trick is to devise some method to hold each screw/washer/spacer on the pegboard, in the correct position & alignment with studs in wall.
In other words, find some way to hold ALL screw/washer/spacer assembles on / in pegboard prior to installing on wall.
Specifically, the DIY team must somehow add a "clip" to hold the screw/washer/spacer after it is on the pegboard, but before the pegboard moved into positioned on the wall.
First, locate the wall studs, then mark the pegboard holes that will align for secure mount
After placing the screw/washer/spacer in each appropriate peg hole, clip the screw/washer/spacer in place.
Lift the pegboard (with all screw/washer/spacer assembles positioned on pegboard) and screw each into wall studs.
We used VERY THIN , but ridged / stiff small cardboard sections, that we snugly threaded on each screw end.
If you know another "clip" technique, go for it.
But, remember this is a two person job, a three person team would be even better.

history.review_excerpt:
This might seem like it should be obvious, but I have been stung on these types of things in the past so it’s good to see a device that has been properly designed and calibrated right out of the box.

The mechanical part of the caliper works exactly as expected, so I am not going to go into that; the digital part is much more interesting.

The digital readout is very clear and easy to understand. The only complaint I have with this caliper is actually this table – the print is so small it’s hard on the eyes.

The caliper comes in a hard plastic case with a foam padded interior, with a cut-out where the caliper fits.
history.review_full:
I do not often need a caliper, though I have used them on the occasions when a measuring tape or similar device is inappropriate. All of the calipers with which I have worked have been strictly mechanical, so this is my first experience with a digital caliper (and also the WEN brand of tools). So far, my experience has been very positive and I am pleased with it.

In a nutshell, it is accurate, it feels solid, it comes in a very good storage case and it’s easy to read.

First things first. I have received other measuring devices that have been inaccurate in measure because the scale was completely off. If an inch isn’t really an inch, a measuring tool is completely useless. I compared this tool to one known to be accurate and was able to determine that the scale is correct, so this tool’s measurements can be trusted for both metric and imperial measures. Comparing the digital readout to the analog, the two numbers match. This might seem like it should be obvious, but I have been stung on these types of things in the past so it’s good to see a device that has been properly designed and calibrated right out of the box.

The mechanical part of the caliper works exactly as expected, so I am not going to go into that; the digital part is much more interesting.

The digital readout is very clear and easy to understand. The default setting is millimeters with precision to 0.01 mm. It can be changed to decimal or fractional inches at the touch of a button. There is another button that sets the measurement to 0, from which further measurement is offset (it’s similar to setting a tare weight on a scale). What I especially find interesting is that the settings are preserved when the unit is turned off and back on again.

The digital assembly of this caliper is fairly compact, relying on a CR2032 button battery. This is a smart design choice as two AAA batteries would have drastically increased the size and the weight.

There are a couple of thoughtful design choices that have gone into this caliper as well. There is a thumb wheel that allows for very simple and easy one-handed operation. A small knob that can be tightened adds a bit of drag when making adjustments too, so it is easy to get very precise without having to readjust over and over. On the back of the caliper there is a printed table that shows measures in inches converted from fractional to decimal equivalents. This table ranges from 1/64” to 1”. The only complaint I have with this caliper is actually this table – the print is so small it’s hard on the eyes.

The caliper comes in a hard plastic case with a foam padded interior, with a cut-out where the caliper fits. The case closes nicely and should not pop open in transit unless it’s abused, and it provides very good protection for the caliper.

Before I worked with this caliper I was unfamiliar with the brand and I was unfamiliar with digital calipers. It has proven to be a very good tool that is accurate, it has some good design features and comes in a good carrying case. It isn’t priced outrageously, either. This is an easy tool to recommend if you need a good caliper.

product.title: WEN 10764 Electronic 6.1" Stainless Steel Water-Resistant Digital Caliper with Lcd Readout & Storage Case, IP54 Rated

history.review_excerpt:
That said, this tape is not a simple apply-and-forget product but requires some planning and attention to detail.

Read the instructions before you simply slap this stuff on a hole or a leak. Of particular note is that the instructions say to round the edges of the patch, so that they're less likely to peel which makes good sense.

This stuff sticks very well. It worked on my air mattress.

I can see cases where this stuff isn't going to work so well, and that is dependent on the surface to which the tape is applied. I would consider using this on plastic PVC pipes as a temporary solution if there is low pressure in the pipes, but for non-pressure applications it is a possible permanent solution.

This tape met my need.
history.review_full:
I selected this tape for a specific purpose - to repair a slowly leaking air mattress. My thinking is that even if the tape doesn't permanently fix the leak it will buy some time. It seems to have done the trick, regardless. That said, this tape is not a simple apply-and-forget product but requires some planning and attention to detail.

Read the instructions before you simply slap this stuff on a hole or a leak. Failing to follow directions might result in a patch that doesn't actually fix the leak. Of particular note is that the instructions say to round the edges of the patch, so that they're less likely to peel which makes good sense.

This stuff sticks very well. Applied carefully and smoothed, it forms a water-tight and air-tight seal. It worked on my air mattress.

I can see cases where this stuff isn't going to work so well, and that is dependent on the surface to which the tape is applied. This is not the right solution for rough surfaces like rusting metal (I'm thinking along the lines of a rusting galvanized bucket) and it's the wrong solution for sealing gutters and other drainage. I would consider using this on plastic PVC pipes as a temporary solution if there is low pressure in the pipes, but for non-pressure applications it is a possible permanent solution.

This tape met my need. It really does work and it's simple and easy to use if you read the instructions and think through the job first. It is not a solution for every problem but it's a good tool to have on hand when you need to seal something that leaks.

product.title: Gorilla Waterproof Patch & Seal Tape, 4" x 8', Clear, (Pack of 2)

This is a pack of 20 very small, heart-shaped magnets that are much stronger than they would appear at a glance. This is really all I needed.

The fact that they're heart-shaped makes them more aesthetically pleasing than just little round discs, though the shape obviously has little to do with their function.

I like these magnets and they have met the need we have for them without issue. Having 20 in the package means I have more than enough for the foreseeable future.
history.review_full:
I selected these magnets with the thought of using them on the refrigerator. We needed something a little more "consistent" than a hodge-podge of odd magnets and fasteners for sticking papers on the refrigerator, and these have answered that need nicely.

This is a pack of 20 very small, heart-shaped magnets that are much stronger than they would appear at a glance. By small I would say they're comparable to a quarter in thickness and about as big around as a green pea. In spite of their size they have strong magnetism and are very capable of holding several sheets of paper to the refrigerator each. This is really all I needed.

The fact that they're heart-shaped makes them more aesthetically pleasing than just little round discs, though the shape obviously has little to do with their function.

I like these magnets and they have met the need we have for them without issue. They might be small but they're very strong. Having 20 in the package means I have more than enough for the foreseeable future.

However, it fits perfectly in the dining room where I keep the majority of my coffee supplies anyway and even though it is on the larger size it gave me a net gain in space.

history.review_full:
I selected this organizer to go on my kitchen counter, thinking it would help to organize coffee supplies and possibly work to keep some of the most commonly used spices at the ready when cooking. It's too big to fit on my counter and I had to change direction with it. I am not unhappy with it though and I found another location for it.

As mentioned, this is a little bigger than I expected and as a result I was not able to put it on my counter as planned. It is a little too tall, and the footprint takes up too much space to be practical in my particular kitchen. So much for that. However, it fits perfectly in the dining room where I keep the majority of my coffee supplies anyway and even though it is on the larger size it gave me a net gain in space.

This is a three-tier organizer that is designed to keep coffee and tea supplies. It is roomy enough to hold a bag of coffee, cups, lids, K-cups, stirrers, filters and more. Taking advantage of height instead of spreading out it keeps things organized while preserving counter space. I loaded it up with filters and stirrers and it has freed up most of a shelf, though it can handle a lot more.

This organizer seems to be well made and sturdy. It is made of hard plastic and can handle some light abuse. I like that the compartments are deep, too, and if maintained (meaning, kept clean) it will serve as a good organizational system.

It is not marketed for home use but it does have a place there too. The main thing I have in this organizer is a large pack of filters; once I have thought through the way I want to organize everything I plan to keep a bag of coffee and a couple of travel cups there too, and I even have a little room left over for a small container of sweetener.

Though it isn't where I originally envisioned it, this coffee organizer is filling the need for which I got it. It's large enough to handle most coffee supplies and seems to be designed and made well.

One of the things that we always seem to need in the house (but have a hard time tracking down) is pairs of scissors. They are well suited for her, though their handles are a little on the small side for me.

This is a two-pack of scissors, one larger pair for kitchen use and one smaller pair for more utility functions. These scissors are too small for me to use comfortably but for her they're close to perfect. So, I would hesitate to say these are one-size-fits-all tools.

Just wipe the floors and throw the pad in the washing machine and you are done. So easy to use. Highly recommend!

history.review_excerpt: My husband is a veterinarian and we have two grandsons (ages 5 and 8). They love visiting him in the office and see him with the dogs and cats. I saw this stethoscope and I knew it would be a big hit with them. They love listening to the heart beat of their own dog and copying what they have seen with their grandpa. They also have listened to my and their parent's hearts, too. I know this isn't necessarily a toy, but I think it's a great learning aid for children to understand how our and our animal's bodies work. Highly recommend!

heldout.review_excerpt: I have an 8x12 area rug on tile in my family room. I have bought all kinds of adhesives to help keep the corners of the rug to lay flat. However, they all seem to just last a short amount of time and then all it takes is one persons foot to catch the edge and the adhesive never holds again. I wanted to try Gorilla tape since I had heard so much about it and I can say I love it! I had rolled it into a two side stick and applied it to all four corners. It is holding my rug flat now for a month and it works just great. It actually cost less than what the rug adhesive strips cost me. So, I highly recommend!

history.review_excerpt:
There are 50 KN95 disposable face masks in this package at the current price of $11.94 ($19.99 minus 40%), which comes to a cheap $.24 cents per mask. Similar to the N95 standard, masks must filter 95% or more of particles to meet the KN95 standard."

These 5-ply masks look, feel, and work like every other disposable mask. I tried one on over my own mask and the ear elastics fit nicely over my ears and the mask coverage is comprehensive, especially for a child.

Overall, these are nice and I love the individual packaging. It is my lack of confidence in the ear elastics that have me rating this 4 instead of 5 stars. The current price and choice of five colors is great, however.
history.review_full:
There are 50 KN95 disposable face masks in this package at the current price of $11.94 ($19.99 minus 40%), which comes to a cheap $.24 cents per mask. Per the Amazon site, " KN95 is a Chinese standard for respirator masks. Similar to the N95 standard, masks must filter 95% or more of particles to meet the KN95 standard."

These 5-ply masks look, feel, and work like every other disposable mask. As is typical with paper masks, the ear elastics are their weakest point. Nevertheless, I still consider these good masks.

These would definitely fit young adults and even teenagers. They will even fit adults with a small face. There is wire along the nose area so that it can be molded to the face for a more secure fit. I tried one on over my own mask and the ear elastics fit nicely over my ears and the mask coverage is comprehensive, especially for a child.

Overall, these are nice and I love the individual packaging. Although it is a nice touch to include some silicone cinches for the ear elastics, I find it impossible to even thread this on. I suppose I'd have to take a needle to pass it through those nubs. It is my lack of confidence in the ear elastics that have me rating this 4 instead of 5 stars. The current price and choice of five colors is great, however.
history.review_title: Works like every other disposable mask; elastics weakest point; silicone elastic cinches provided

product.title: XDX Kids KN95 Masks for Children, 25 Pack Individually Wrapped Black Disposable Face Masks, 5 Layers KN95 Mask for Kids, Breathable & Comfortable, Filter Efficiency ≥95%

history.review_excerpt:
I have [[ASIN:B08KGTL2QG these wipes]] which are EXACTLY the same as these and which I have been using regularly for six months.

These are DRY wipes that have to be wet. There are 150 in this package. The problem is that I use paper towels or wet wipes to clean that are more disposable and can be thrown away after the initial use. I feel bad throwing these away, so I use them to wipe down my kitchen sink and countertops several times per day. These remind me of the lasting power of the cloth Handi Wipes.

The current price of $14.39 for 150 9"x9" wipes comes to $0.10 cents per wipe which is very reasonable in my opinion as long as one is going to reuse these. I really love these since they are definitely reusable.
history.review_full:
I have [[ASIN:B08KGTL2QG these wipes]] which are EXACTLY the same as these and which I have been using regularly for six months.

These are DRY wipes that have to be wet. There are 150 in this package. They are very strong and remind me of an everlasting paper towel. The problem is that I use paper towels or wet wipes to clean that are more disposable and can be thrown away after the initial use. I feel bad throwing these away, so I use them to wipe down my kitchen sink and countertops several times per day. Each wipe lasts me two weeks. These remind me of the lasting power of the cloth Handi Wipes.

The current price of $14.39 for 150 9"x9" wipes comes to $0.10 cents per wipe which is very reasonable in my opinion as long as one is going to reuse these. If these are used like paper towels, then I would consider that wasteful. I really love these since they are definitely reusable.
history.review_title: 150 everlasting DRY cloths; promotes waste unless used repeatedly to clean

history.review_excerpt:
I got this tape hoping it could be decoration on an industrial looking MAME video game case and I was not disappointed at all. The tape has a great vinyl feel to it and it molded to the texture of the siding beautifully. the yellow and black pattern is far more vibrant than I was hoping for and it is doing the job perfectly of adding a colorful accent to the cabinet.

Time will tell how it will wear, but I have very high hopes for my use as it should not see a lot of wear. I really love this tape, although I'm not sure what I'll do with the remaining 20 or so yards. I'm finding myself looking for possible hazards to mark with it.
history.review_full:
